name: Sodium Hypochlorite
desc: Sodium Hypochlorite is an inorganic chemical compound, the sodium salt of hypochlorous acid. The chemical is distinguished from other compounds by its antiseptic, bleaching and biocidal properties.
techs: The substance has a characteristic chlorine odor. It has a straw-yellow or yellow-green color. Sodium Hypochlorite has oxidizing, corrosive, antiseptic and bactericidal properties. In its pure form, the compound is very unstable, so only its aqueous solution is sold or used.
shelf: The shelf life of Sodium Hypochlorite is up to 2 years from the date of manufacture.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Sodium Hypochlorite in IBC containers or Cisterns.
applications: Sodium Hypochlorite is used in many industries. Among others, it is used in the production of paper as a bleaching agent, the production of detergents, the treatment of household and industrial waste, in the disinfection of technical spaces.
